Info.Description: The Kingdom of Bretonnia, also known as the Land of Chivalry, is a highly martial feudal kingdom that lies between the lands of the Grey Mountains and the Great Ocean. Bretonnia is second only in size to that of the Empire, both their chief rival and closest ally, having a culture and society that revolves around the ideals of nobility, social birthright, and the upholding of a strictly enforced code of chivalry.\n\nRuled by a Royarch, the nation of Bretonnia has been known throughout the kingdoms of man for having the greatest Knights in the entire Old World, even surpassing that of the Knightly Orders of the Empire. A proud and honourable kingdom, the armies of Bretonnia are comprised mostly of knights and noblemen, who ride into battle with lance, horse, and sword, seeking glory and rooting out injustice wherever they go. The Knights of Bretonnia are trained to fight from childhood, and even the lowliest Knights Errant are considered superior to ordinary warriors. Their skills are further enhanced through constant training, battles and tournaments. It is not only Bretonnia's knights who are famed, however, for the kingdom also boasts the finest human sailors in the World. With their great sails billowing in the wind, Bretonnia's mighty fleets are a majestic sight on the high seas. Due to this regime, the combined military might of Bretonnia has surpassed that of even the greatest armies in history

LocalSpecialRules.LeadershipOfKnight: May use the Leadership of any non-fleeing Knight within 6" of them; unit Standards do not confer any additional Victory Points if they are captured

Weapon.Name: Virtue of the Penitent
Weapon.Description: The Knight is Stubborn, though he may never join any friendly units. He may not take any magic items, nor may he ride a Hippogryph or a Royal Pegasus

Weapon.Name: Virtue of Knightly Temper
Weapon.Rule: For each attack that the Knight hits and wounds with on the charge (before Saves etc,), he may make an additional attack
Weapon.Description: For each attack that the Knight hits and wounds with on the charge (before Saves etc,), he may make an additional attack. For example, if a Paladin hits and wounds with two attacks he can make two additional attacks immediately. Extra attacks are not generated if these additional attacks also hit and wound. A character with this Virtue may not use magic weapons

Weapon.Name: Virtue of Heroism
Weapon.Description: Against Large Targets, and if armed with a non-magical weapon, the Knight has the Killing Blow special ability. This overrides the normal limitation of Killing Blow only affecting man-sized models

Weapon.Name: Virtue of Stoicism
Weapon.Description: The Knight (and any unit he has joined) may re-roll failed Break tests

Weapon.Name: Virtue of the Ideal
Weapon.Description: The Knight gains the following bonuses to his profile: +2 Weapon Skill, +1 Initiative, +1 Attack. He may not be the army's General (even if he has the highest Leadership) and any friendly unit (including other Knightly characters, or units using a Knight's Leadership) taking any form of Leadership test within 6" of this model suffers a -1 penalty to their Leadership

Weapon.Name: Virtue of the Impetuous Knight
Weapon.Description: The Knight, and any mounted unit he is with, adds +D6" for the first charge that they declare (roll after declaring the charge). If the charge is failed the unit will not add this extra D6" to their failed charge movement

Weapon.Name: Virtue of Audacity
Weapon.Rule: May re-roll any failed rolls to hit and to wound against enemies with a higher Strength than himself (before modifications from weapons etc)
Weapon.Description: Against enemies with a higher Strength than himself (before modifications from weapons etc), the Knight may re-roll any failed rolls to hit and to wound

Weapon.Name: Virtue of Duty
Weapon.Description: One per army. May not be taken by the General. For as long as the General is alive, the model with this Virtue adds +1 to the combat resolution of any fight of which he is a part

Weapon.Name: Virtue of the Joust
Weapon.Rule: May re-roll failed rolls to hit when charging and using a lance
Weapon.Description: The Knight may re-roll failed rolls to hit when charging and using a lance (including magical lances)

Weapon.Name: Virtue of Confidence
Weapon.Description: The Knight must always issue challenges, and will always accept them if possible. In challenges, the Knight may re-roll all failed rolls to hit and to wound

Weapon.Name: Virtue of Noble Disdain
Weapon.Description: The Knight hates all enemies using missile weapons including war machine crews. In addition, any unit the Knight has joined never takes Panic tests caused by suffering 25% casualties (eg, shooting, magic, etc)

Weapon.Name: Virtue of Purity
Weapon.Description: The Knight will always start the game with the Blessing of the Lady, even if the army did not pray. In addition, the Ward save which the Knight gains from the Blessing is always 5+, regardless of the Strength of the attack

Weapon.Name: Virtue of Discipline
Weapon.Rule: The enemy never gets a +1 combat resolution bonus for outnumbering in any combat that the character is involved in
Weapon.Description: The enemy never gets a +1 combat resolution bonus for outnumbering in any combat that the character is involved in. Note, however, that he and any unit he has joined will still flee automatically if beaten by a fear-causing enemy that outnumbers them, as per the normal rules

Weapon.Name: Virtue of Empathy
Weapon.Rule: Peasant units within 12" of him may use his Leadership
Weapon.Description: The Knight may be fielded on foot. In addition, if he is not the army's General, Peasant units within 12" of him may use his Leadership, rather than the normal distance of 6"

Weapon.Name: The Silver Lance of the Blessed
Weapon.Rule: If the model has the Blessing of the Lady, then all attacks with the Silver Lance Of the Blessed automatically hit
Weapon.Description: The bearer has +2 Strength on the charge when mounted. If the model has the Blessing of the Lady, then all attacks with the Silver Lance Of the Blessed automatically hit

Weapon.Name: Sword of the Quest
Weapon.Rule: May be used a hand weapon or a great weapon, decided at the start of combat as normal
Weapon.Description: May be used as either a hand weapon or a great weapon, decided at the start of combat as normal. No Armour saves may be taken against the Sword of the Quest

Weapon.Name: Sword of the Lady's Champion
Weapon.Description: The character always counts their Strength as one higher than their target's Toughness, unless their Strength would normally be more than this. In effect this means that they will always wound opponents on at least a 3+. This modified Strength is also used to calculate Armour save modifiers

Weapon.Name: Sword of Heroes
Weapon.Rule: +1 Strength and D3 wounds against enemies that have Toughness 5 or greater
Weapon.Description: Against enemies that have Toughness 5 or greater, the bearer gets +1 Strength and each unsaved wound caused by the Sword of Heroes becomes D3 wounds rather than 1

Weapon.Name: The Heartwood Lance
Weapon.Description: The bearer has +2 Strength on the charge when mounted. The Heartwood Lance allows the bearer to re-roll all failed rolls to wound

Weapon.Name: Birth-sword of Carcassonne
Weapon.Description: The sword acids +1 Strength to the bearer. Enemies wounded by the sword must re-roll any successful Armour saves

Weapon.Name: Morning Star of Fracasse
Weapon.Rule: For each hit on a close combat opponent, roll a D6. On a 4+, if the opponent has a magic weapon, it is destroyed
Weapon.Description: The bearer has +2 Strength in the first round of combat. For each hit on a close combat opponent, roll a D6. On a 4+, if the opponent has a magic weapon, it is destroyed

Weapon.Name: The Lance of Artois
Weapon.Description: The bearer has +2 Strength on the charge when mounted. In addition, the lance confers the Killing Blow special rule onto the bearer, but only on turns during which the character charges

Weapon.Name: The Wyrmlance
Weapon.Rule: Once per game, may make a breath attack from the tip of the lance at Strength 3 provided he is not in close combat
Weapon.Description: The bearer has +2 Strength on the charge when mounted. In addition, once per game, the model wielding the Wyrmlance may make a breath attack from the tip of the lance at Strength 3 provided he is not in close combat. Furthermore, all attacks made by the Wyrmlance count as flaming attacks

Armour.Name: Gilded Cuirass
Armour.Description: Character with the Grail Vow only. This armour replaces the Knight's heavy armour, and gives a 5+ Armour save that can be combined with other equipment as normal. In addition, the wearer has Regeneration

Armour.Name: Armour of the Midsummer Sun
Armour.Rule: Opponents suffer a -1 penalty to all rolls to hit the wearer and his mount with missile weapons and in close combat
Armour.Description: This armour replaces the Knight's heavy armour, and gives a 5+ Armour save that may be combined with other armour as normal. Opponents suffer a -1 penalty to all rolls to hit the wearer and his mount with missile weapons and in close combat

Shield.Name: The Grail Shield
Shield.Description: The shield provides a 6+ Armour save which may be combined with other armour as normal. The bearer's Ward save gained from the Blessing of the Lady is increased to 4+ against attacks of any Strength. If the model loses the Blessing, they lose this Ward save as normal

Additional.Name: Gromril Great Helm
Additional.Description: Gives a 6+ Armour save and may be worn in addition to normal armour. The wearer may re-roll failed Armour saves

Armour.Name: Armour of Agilulf
Armour.Description: This armour replaces the Knight's heavy armour and includes a shield, giving a 4+ Armour save. The shield must be used at all times - so the wearer cannot use a weapon that requires two hands. In addition, the armour confers Weapon Skill 10 (which cannot be altered with other items. Virtues, etc) to whoever is wearing it

Armour.Name: Cuirass of Fortune
Armour.Description: This armour replaces the Knight's heavy armour, and gives a 5+ Annour save which may be combined with other armour as normal. When rolling to wound in close combat, the Knight may re-roll any dice rolls of 1

Shield.Name: Orcbane Shield
Shield.Rule: Any unengaged Ore or Goblin unit within 12" that must take an Animosity test fails it on a 1-2 instead of a 1
Shield.Description: Gives a 6+ Armour save and may be combined with other armour as normal. Any unengaged Ore or Goblin unit within 12" that must take an Animosity test fails it on a 1-2 instead of a 1

Additional.Name: Sirienne's Locket
Additional.Description: A Knight with Sirienne's Locket can never suffer more than one-wound in any one phase from non-magical attacks - even multiple wound weapons (including war machines) can only cause a single wound. After the first wound in that phase is suffered, all subsequent wounds suffered during that phase are ignored. The bearer can still be run down by pursuing enemies as normal, and may still be affected as normal by Killing Blow

Additional.Name: Token of the Damsel
Additional.Description: Against the first wounding hit suffered, the Knight gains a 2+ Ward save

Additional.Name: Insignia of the Quest
Additional.Description: If the hearer is ever reduced to 1 Wound, then the Knight instantly gains a 3+ Ward save. If the character suffers multiple wounds that would kill him hefore he has gained this Ward save (eg, if he has more than one wound left and is hit by a cannon ball), he will be reduced to 1 Wound, then may attempt his 3+ Ward save to stay alive and nullify any further wounds caused by the same hit

Additional.Name: Braid of Bordeleaux
Additional.Rule: One use only: until the beginning of the next Bretonnian turn, the character's Leadership value is increased by 1
Additional.Description: One use only. The Braid may be used at the start of any Bretonnian turn. Until the beginning of the next Bretonnian turn, the character's Leadership value is increased by 1. In addition, once the Braid has been used, until the start of the next Bretonnian turn, the model bearing the Braid and any unit he is with can move over marsh, rivers, lakes or any other water features without penalty and will benefit from soft cover while in such terrain

Additional.Name: Dragon's Claw
Additional.Description: The bearer's Ward save gained from the Blessing of the Lady is increased to 5+ against attacks of any Strength. If the model loses the Blessing, then it loses this Ward save as normal. In addition, as long as the bearer has the Blessing, he is immune to lire based attacks (such as Dragon's breath. Warp-fire Throwers and spells from the Lore of Fire)

Additional.Name: Mantle of Damsel Elena
Additional.Description: Poisoned attacks do not wound automatically against a character with the Mantle. In addition, the special rules for Killing Blow-have no effect on the character

Additional.Name: Falcon-horn of Fredemund
Additional.Rule: Until the start of the next Bretonnian turn, no enemy unit may fly, one use only
Additional.Description: One use only. The Horn may he sounded at the start of any Bretonnian turn. Until the start of the next Bretonnian turn, no enemy unit may fly - they are forced to use their ground movement. Note that this may also alter the enemies flee/pursuit distance

Additional.Name: Holy Icon
Additional.Description: The Holy Icon gives the character Magic Resistance (3)

Additional.Name: The Ruby Goblet
Additional.Rule: This magic item will start to take effect at the end of the first phase during which the bearer or his unit suffers an unsaved wound; from that moment on, the bearer (and any unit he is with) cannot be wounded on better than a 3+ from any non-magical source
Additional.Description: This magic item will start to take effect at the end of the first phase during which the bearer or his unit suffers an unsaved wound. From that moment on, the bearer (and any unit he is with) cannot be wounded on better than a 3+ from any non-magical source

Additional.Name: The Mane of the Purebreed
Additional.Rule: +1 Strength to the character's Warhorse and those of any unit he is with the first time they charge
Additional.Description: Character on Warhorse only. The Mane confers +1 Strength to the character's Warhorse and those of any unit he is with the first time they charge

Additional.Name: Antlers of the Great Hunt
Additional.Rule: The Knight (and any unit he is with) may roll an additional dice when pursuing and choose the highest three (two if on foot)

Additional.Name: Tress of Isoulde
Additional.Rule: Nominate one enemy model at the beginning of any Close Combat phase: the bearer hits that model on a 2+ for that Close Combat round, regardless of other modifiers
Additional.Description: Nominate one enemy model at the beginning of any Close Combat phase. The bearer hits that model on a 2+ for that Close Combat round, regardless of other modifiers

Additional.Name: Gauntlet of the Duel
Additional.Rule: Any challenge issued cannot be refused
Additional.Description: Any challenge issued by the bearer of the Gauntlet of the Duel cannot be refused

Arcane.Name: The Silver Mirror
Arcane.Rule: May be used with the exact same effects as a Dispel Scroll, in addition, the enemy Wizard who cast the spell suffers an immediate Strength 6 hit, one use only
Arcane.Description: One use only. May be used with the exact same effects as a Dispel Scroll. In addition, the enemy Wizard who cast the spell suffers an immediate Strength 6 hit

Arcane.Name: Sacrament of the Lady
Arcane.Rule: At the start of any Bretonnian Magic phase, the hearer may use the Sacrament: the model generates double its usual number of Power dice, but may not cast any spells that turn, each time the Sacramente are used, roll a dice: on a 1 the model has run out of wafers and after that turn the Sacrament cannot be used for the remainder of the game
Arcane.Description: At the start of any Bretonnian Magic phase, the hearer may use the Sacrament. The model generates double its usual number of Power dice, but may not cast any spells that turn. Each time the Sacramente are used, roll a dice. On a 1 the model has run out of wafers and after that turn the Sacrament cannot be used for the remainder of the game

Arcane.Name: The Verdant Heart
Arcane.Rule: Any wood or forest that the bearer is within counts as very difficult terrain as long as the character remains wholly within the terrain feature
In addition, the bearer gains +1 to cast spells from the Lore of Life
Arcane.Description: Any wood or forest that the bearer is within counts as very difficult terrain as long as the character remains wholly within the terrain feature. In addition, the bearer gains +1 to cast spells from the Lore of Life

Arcane.Name: Prayer Icon of Quenelles
Arcane.Rule: One use only: the bearer and the unit she is with are immediately granted the Blessing of the Lady
Arcane.Description: One use only. The Prayer Icon can be revealed at any time. The bearer and the unit she is with are immediately granted the Blessing of the Lady. This can allow a unit that has lost the blessing to regain it

Arcane.Name: Chalice of Malfleur
Arcane.Rule: At the start of the opponent's Magic phase, may drink from the Chalice: if she does so, on the roll of a 1 she suffers a wound with no saves allowed, including Ward saves. On a roll of 2-6, an extra Dispel dice is added to the player's pool
Arcane.Description: At the start of the opponent's Magic phase, the bearer may drink from the Chalice. If she does so, on the roll of a 1 she suffers a wound with no saves allowed, including Ward saves. On a roll of 2-6, an extra Dispel dice is added to the player's pool

Arcane.Name: Potion Sacre
Arcane.Rule: This is used before rolling the dice to cast or dispel a spell: after the dice are rolled, the player may add +1 to the result of one dice, one use only
Arcane.Description: One use only. This is used before rolling the dice to cast or dispel a spell. After the dice are rolled, the player may add +1 to the result of one dice. This may cause Irresistible Force or prevent a Miscast

Banner.Name: Banner of the Lady
Banner.Rule: All enemy units with al least one model in base contact with the bearer of the Banner of the Lady get no combat bonus for ranks
Banner.Description: Model on foot or on Bretonnian Warhorse only. All enemy units with al least one model in base contact with the bearer of the Banner of the Lady get no combat bonus for ranks

Banner.Name: Valorous Standard
Banner.Description: Knights unit only. The unit rolls 3D6 for all Leadership based tests (including Break tests) and discards the highest

Banner.Name: Banner of Defence
Banner.Rule: As long as the unit is affected by the Blessing of the Lady, all models in a unit with the Banner gain a 4+ Ward save against all missiles (including magic missiles) with Strength 5 or more
Banner.Description: As long as the unit is affected by the Blessing of the Lady, all models in a unit with the Banner gain a 4+ Ward save against all missiles (including magic missiles) with Strength 5 or more. If the Blessing of the Lady is lost, then the Banner loses this ability

Banner.Name: Twilight Banner
Banner.Rule: One use only: in the Remaining Moves section of the turn unit suffer no movement penalties for moving over difficult terrain or obstacles, or from any other reductions to movement, they can move through buildings just as easily, but cannot move through other units
Banner.Description: One use only. The Twilight Banner can only be used in the Remaining Moves section of the turn (so a unit cannot use it on the turn it charges). They suffer no movement penalties for moving over difficult terrain or obstacles, or from any other reductions to movement. They can move through buildings just as easily, but cannot move through other units. In addition, they cannot end their move inside impassable terrain. These effects work only for that one Movement phase

Banner.Name: Conqueror's Tapestry
Banner.Rule: Every enemy standard captured is worth 200 Victory Points instead of 100
Banner.Description: Every enemy standard captured by the unit possessing the Conqueror's Tapestry is worth 200 Victory Points instead of 100. If an enemy unit captures the Conqueror's Tapestry, the enemy gains 200 Victory Points rather than 100

Banner.Name: Errantry Banner
Banner.Rule: All Knights Errant in the unit get a +1 Strength bonus on any turn they charge
Banner.Description: Knights Errant only. All Knights Errant in the unit get a +1 Strength bonus on any turn they charge (no effect on steeds or characters). However, a unit with this banner suffers -2 to its Ld for any Impetuous tests

Banner.Name: Banner of Chalons
Banner.Rule: The enemy cannot choose the stand and shoot reaction
Banner.Description: The enemy cannot choose the stand and shoot reaction against the unit carrying the Banner

Lord.Name: Green Knight
Lord.Description: The Green Knight, the champion of the Lady of the Lake

SpecialRules.Original: He suffers no movement penalties for moving over or through any kind of terrain; He never suffers any movement penalties, even from such things as magical effects

HandWeapon.Name: The Dolorous Blade
HandWeapon.Rule: The Dolorous Blade may be used in one of two ways. Either the Green Knight can use the Blade to gain +D6 Attacks, or it can be used to add +2 to his Strength. The Green Knight may change which method he is using to attack with in each Close Combat phase if he wishes to.

Original.Rule: One model in the Bretonnian army may be given the Favour of the Fay, this model may add +1 on all rolls to hit in close combat; however, if the model loses the Blessing of the Lady, then both the Favoured model and the Fay Enchantress take a wound that cannot be saved by Armour or Ward saves
Bretonnian army does not need to pray at the start of the game to gain the Blessing of the Lady
Ward save gained from the Blessing of the Lady is increased to 5+ against any attack
The Fay Enchantress may be accompanied by 2-8 Grail Guardians, the Fay Enchantress can never choose to leave this unit
Against Skaven, Ores and Goblins and all Beasts of Chaos she causes Terror
May use any of the eight lores
+2 to cast Lore of Life spells

Arcane.Name: The Chalice of Potions
Arcane.Rule: At any point during each Bretonnian Magic phase, the Fay Enchantress may peer into the Chalice and stir up magical power to use against her foes: roll a D6 each time the Chalice is used, the number refers to which spell is automatically cast from the Lore of Heavens as a Bound Spell (at the Power Level equal to the minimum casting level for the spell)

Original.Rule: If Louen is removed as a casualty, all Bretonnian units must take a Panic test; Such is the determination to reclaim their fallen ruler that all Bretonnian troops count as stubborn for the rest of the battle
The 0-1 restriction on Grail Knights is lifted, Men-at-arms and Bowmen become Special choices

Armour.Name: The Crown of Bretonnia
Armour.Rule: Friendly troops may use Louen Leoncoeur's Leadership characteristic when he is within 18" instead of the usual 12"; Any unit with line of sight to him is immune to panic

Armour.Name: The Lion's Shield
Armour.Rule: Louen has a Magic Resistance value equal to the total number of dice used in the casting of any spell that affects him

SpecialRules.Original: After charges have been declared, if unit did not declare a charge but are within charge range of an enemy, then they must take a Leadership test to restrain themselves from charging; if this test is failed, they are forced to charge; if the test is passed, they may move normally; in addition, so reckless are the Knights Errant, that whenever they charge, the unit and any characters that have joined them are Immune to Psychology for the rest of that turn
No unit gains any charge bonus when they charge the unit's front
May re-roll any failed Psychology tests

Original.Rule: 5+ Ward save versus attacks with Strength 5 or higher
Every model in a unit of Grail Knights can issue and accept challenges as if they were a Champion
